Articles.Content:
Hello.  I was first introduced to KSP by watching Scott Manley and Tim Dodd as they explained some rocket science.  I'm really geeked over the whole Starship thing and I can't seem to get enough.  Anyway, I'd seen them use it to teach a few things, and/or talk about how cool of a game it was, but I never thought I'd be playing it.  Then, I had some free time, and here I are.  I really like it, but it crashes a lot, to the point that I had reinstalled it a few weeks ago.  This time, I left it vanilla, figuring it was probably either a mod, or a combination between steam and a mod that was causing it to mess up.  Well, three weeks or so into the new install, and a completely different game save, and it's crashing again.  It doesn't load.  It hangs and crashes, and I can't tell what the log file is telling me is the problem.

So, being a complete newb to the game, and also to the forum, I came here for help.  I've read about the need to upload my log file, so first I have to learn how/where to do that.  And then, I suppose we will want to look at the laptop specs, but I don't know specifically what specs to list.

So, if anyone would be willing to take baby steps with an old wannabe geek, I'd really appreciate the help.

TYIA - please be gentle.

Again, it's a stock game, it's running through steam, on a new win10/64 laptop.  The graphics card is NVIDIA 3070 (I don't know if it's configured properly.  As an old man, I notice that the driver software is not the same and I don't know how to use it).  I think I have it set to use NVIDIA exclusively for games, and not the intel crap.  So, rather than me giving you all a list of information you don't want, can you give me a list of what you do want, and directions on where to upload my log file, and if there's any other files you need?

Thanks again.

Welcome to the forum.   You didn't do anything wrong when you posted this to the newbie welcome subforum, but given the nature of your question I have moved it to the support subforum since more of the problem solver types hang around there. I hope they can offer you some helpful suggestion.

2 hours ago, Vanamonde said:

Welcome to the forum.   You didn't do anything wrong when you posted this to the newbie welcome subforum, but given the nature of your question I have moved it to the support subforum since more of the problem solver types hang around there. I hope they can offer you some helpful suggestion. 

Thank you.

Here’s a handy guide to getting your log files and making them available: 

For PC/laptop specs it’s usually RAM and CPU clock speed that matter- KSP is bottlenecked by single-core processor speed as the physics calculations are all done in one processor thread and have to be run for each frame on the screen, but that only really affects how slow the game gets with lots of parts on the same craft; if you run out of RAM the game (and sometimes the PC/laptop itself) will probably freeze and/or crash, which sounds like what you’re seeing.

Try running KSP with task manager open on the tab that shows all the graphs (performance?) and watch your RAM use as it loads- if you hit 100% or close to it, you’re probably running out of RAM and the only way that I know to fix that with stock KSP is to get more RAM. Close everything you possibly can that isn’t KSP before playing KSP to save RAM, even Steam itself once the game starts loading.

18 hours ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

Here’s a handy guide to getting your log files and making them available: 

For PC/laptop specs it’s usually RAM and CPU clock speed that matter- KSP is bottlenecked by single-core processor speed as the physics calculations are all done in one processor thread and have to be run for each frame on the screen, but that only really affects how slow the game gets with lots of parts on the same craft; if you run out of RAM the game (and sometimes the PC/laptop itself) will probably freeze and/or crash, which sounds like what you’re seeing.

Try running KSP with task manager open on the tab that shows all the graphs (performance?) and watch your RAM use as it loads- if you hit 100% or close to it, you’re probably running out of RAM and the only way that I know to fix that with stock KSP is to get more RAM. Close everything you possibly can that isn’t KSP before playing KSP to save RAM, even Steam itself once the game starts loading.

Thank you for the reply. 

The processor is    Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-10870H CPU @ 2.20GHz, 2208 Mhz, 8 Core(s), 16 Logical Processor(s), and 16 gig of physical ram.

The GPU is Name    NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Laptop GPU with 8 gig.

I will try as you suggest, but my issue is at the loading screen.  It does seem to revolve (possibly) around graphics because if I delete the settings.cfg it seems to load (after recreating the file), but at a reduced screen size resolution.  It seems mostly to happen when I go for full res or full screen, although I have not confirmed fully.

Also, when I look at the log file, I see a lot of warnings [WRN] about wheel colliders, box colliders, texture compression, but the only ERR I see is "[ERR 22:51:59.361] <color=orange><b>[KSPSteamController]:</b> Failed to initialize Steam API!</color>"

Edited August 27, 2021 by Lefty
